unnormalised: Hey everyone! Been thinking a lot about urban gym culture lately, especially here in Mumbai. It’s exploded, right? Used to be, going to the gym was something only a few did, maybe to prep for a marathon or something. Now, it's almost a daily ritual for so many.
normalised: Hey everyone! Been thinking a lot about urban gym culture lately, especially here in Mumbai. It’s exploded, right? Used to be, going to the gym was something only a few did, maybe to prep for a marathon or something. Now, it's almost a daily ritual for so many.

unnormalised: What I find interesting is how it's become so intertwined with the overall lifestyle. It’s not just about lifting weights or running on a treadmill anymore. It's about the community, the athleisure wear (Lululemon, anyone?), the protein shakes afterwards at the local juice shop. You even see pre-wedding workouts gaining popularity! My cousin, Priya, swore by hers before her Udaipur wedding last year.
normalised: What I find interesting is how it's become so intertwined with the overall lifestyle. It’s not just about lifting weights or running on a treadmill anymore. It's about the community, the athleisure wear (Lululemon, anyone?), the protein shakes afterwards at the local juice shop. You even see pre-wedding workouts gaining popularity! My cousin, Priya, swore by hers before her Udaipur wedding last year.

unnormalised: There's a gym popping up on every corner in Bandra, each claiming to be better than the last – HIIT studios, CrossFit boxes, massive multi-level complexes spanning thousands of sq ft with all the latest equipment. Some even boast Dr. approved nutritional plans!
normalised: There's a gym popping up on every corner in Bandra, each claiming to be better than the last – H I I T studios, CrossFit boxes, massive multi-level complexes spanning thousands of square feet with all the latest equipment. Some even boast Doctor approved nutritional plans!

unnormalised: Of course, this comes with a price. Gym memberships can be quite expensive, ranging from Rs. 5000 to Rs. 15000 per month (or even more!). And let's be honest, the pressure to look a certain way is definitely there. Instagram definitely plays a role in that.
normalised: Of course, this comes with a price. Gym memberships can be quite expensive, ranging from rupee five thousand to rupee fifteen thousand per month (or even more!). And let's be honest, the pressure to look a certain way is definitely there. Instagram definitely plays a role in that.

unnormalised: But on the whole, I think the increased focus on fitness is a positive thing. Even a 3 km walk daily counts. It shows a growing awareness of health and well-being, even if it's sometimes masked in a veneer of "getting those abs".
normalised: But on the whole, I think the increased focus on fitness is a positive thing. Even a three kilometer walk daily counts. It shows a growing awareness of health and well-being, even if it's sometimes masked in a veneer of "getting those abs".

unnormalised: What are your thoughts on the urban gym culture? Any experiences to share, especially from other cities like Bangalore or Delhi? Let's chat!
normalised: What are your thoughts on the urban gym culture? Any experiences to share, especially from other cities like Bangalore or Delhi? Let's chat!
